name: causes
description: One concept leads to or results in another.
example: A foul caused the pass to be incomplete.

name: prevents
description: One concept stops another from occurring.
example: A turnover prevents the offensive team from continuing their possession.

name: requires
description: One concept needs another to occur or be valid.
example: A completed pass requires possession of the disc.

name: is example of
description: One concept is a specific instance or category of another.
example: A travel is an example of a violation.

name: is determined by
description: One concept is decided or defined by another.
example: Best perspective is determined by the player's view of the play.

name: changes to
description: One concept alters the condition or status of another.
example: A check changes a dead disc to a live disc.

name: is inside
description: One concept is within the boundaries of another.
example: A disc is inside the endzone.

name: contests
description: One concept is in competition with another.
example: A player contests a foul call.
